page.title: 06Mentmore:New homes from old
page.content: Turning back to the village, the opposite side is dominated by the Stag Public House and Restaurant, which predates the mansion, below which are two outlying cottages, the white one being the former estate dairy and the red brick one the former Home Farm, now unoccupied. Up a grassy lane are the remains of extensive glasshouses, once some of the finest in Europe, built about 1883, and also the old village Septic Tank. A rambling pre- estate cottage stands at the corner of the Green, with the small Village Hall opposite, built as a reading room for men only, now renovated and open for hire. After 2 estate cottages comes Lark Rise House, once the estate carpenter's shop, but built to resemble a house, this is now a most comfortable and attractive residence.
